summary: This bill, the Department of Homeland Security Vehicular Terrorism Prevention and Mitigation Act of 2025, mandates a report from the Secretary of Homeland Security on efforts to prevent, deter, and respond to vehicular terrorism. The report will assess threats, review vulnerable locations, summarize DHS actions, evaluate stakeholder engagement, describe coordination with law enforcement, recommend technology development, address privacy concerns, and detail public awareness initiatives. An unclassified executive summary will be published. Annual briefings to congressional committees are also required.
